tit.cmt: ローマ字表記は後列の表記に合わせています。

sen.j: 県主(あがたのぬし)は、律令制が導入される以前のヤマト王権の職種・カバネ（かばね)の一つである。
sen.e: The term "agatanonushi" refers to a post or kabane (hereditary title) of Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty) before the introduction of the ritsuryo system.

The term "agatanonushi" refers to a post or kabane (hereditary title) of Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty) before the introduction of the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

The term "agatanonushi" refers to a post or kabane (hereditary title) of Yamato sovereignty (the ancient Japan sovereignty) before the introduction of the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

sen.j: ヤマト王権が直轄する行政区分の一つに県（あがた）があった。
sen.e: Agata was a kind of province over which Yamato sovereignty had direct control.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Agata was a kind of province over which Yamato sovereignty had direct control.
Agata was a kind of province over which Yamato sovereignty had direct control.

sen.j: 県（あがた）は、令制国の下部に有った行政区分と言われている。
sen.e: Agata is said to have been a province that ranked below ryoseikoku (a kind of province)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/令制国: terms欄のカッコ内の説明を、文脈により一部変更しています。
sen.e: Agata is said to have been a province that ranked below ryoseikoku (a kind of province)
Agata is said to have been a province that ranked below ryoseikoku (a kind of province)

sen.j: ただし、古くは国と県を同列に扱っていたとする説もある。
sen.e: But there is also a theory that ryoseikoku and agata were treated equally in ancient times.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/国: Webで確認したところ、前列の「令制国」を指していたため、その意味で訳しています。
sen.e: But there is also a theory that ryoseikoku and agata were treated equally in ancient times.
But there is also a theory that ryoseikoku and agata were treated equally in ancient times.

sen.j: 古くはその地方の豪族が治めていた小国家の範囲であったと考えられる。
sen.e: Agata is considered to have been originally a toparchy governed by a local ruling family in ancient times.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/小国家:英辞郎 on the Web
sen.e: Agata is considered to have been originally a toparchy governed by a local ruling family in ancient times.
Agata is considered to have been originally a toparchy governed by a local ruling family in ancient times.

sen.j: しかしながらその詳細は律令国が整備される前の行政区分であるためはっきりとはしていない部分が多い。
sen.e: However, most of the details are unknown because it was a province in a time when the Japanese nation had not yet been systematized under the ritsuryo codes.
However, most of the details are unknown because it was a province in a time when the Japanese nation had not yet been systematized under the ritsuryo codes.
However, most of the details are unknown because it was a province in a time when the Japanese nation had not yet been systematized under the ritsuryo codes.

sen.j: 地方の豪族がそのまま任じられたと言われている国造（くにのみやっこ）とは違い、県主はヤマト王権への忠誠度が高かった。
sen.e: Agatanonushi gave his great loyalty to Yamato sovereignty, which was a difference from kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) that are said to have been appointed as rulers of the regions formerly governed by them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Agatanonushi gave his great loyalty to Yamato sovereignty, unlike kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) that are said to have been appointed as rulers of the regions formerly governed by them.

Agatanonushi gave his great loyalty to Yamato sovereignty, unlike kuninomiyatsuko (local ruling families in ancient Japan) that are said to have been appointed as rulers of the regions formerly governed by them.

sen.j: ヤマト王権の代権者としてその地方を治めたと考えられている。
sen.e: Agatanonushi is considered to have governed the region as a deputy of Yamato sovereignty.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/代権者: 定訳不明
sen.e: Agatanonushi is considered to have governed the region as a deputy of Yamato sovereignty.
Agatanonushi is considered to have governed the region as a deputy of Yamato sovereignty.

sen.j: 県主は、西日本に集中し、東日本には少なかった。
sen.e: Agatanonushi concentrated in western Japan, while there were only few agatanonushi in eastern Japan.
Agatanonushi concentrated in western Japan, while there were only few agatanonushi in eastern Japan.
Agatanonushi concentrated in western Japan, while there were only few agatanonushi in eastern Japan.

sen.j: ヤマト王権の支配が確立する時期が遅かった東日本では、ヤマト王権に帰属した豪族達にその支配地域をそのまま治めさせた。
sen.e: Yamato sovereignty made the local ruling families belonging to it govern their territory in eastern Japan where its ruling system was established in a later period than in western Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yamato sovereignty made the local ruling families belonging to it govern their territory in eastern Japan where its ruling system was established in a later period than in western Japan.
Yamato sovereignty made the local ruling families belonging to it govern their territory in eastern Japan where its ruling system was established in a later period than in western Japan.

sen.j: ほぼ全権を委任する国造として据え置かれた。
sen.e: They were appointed as kuninomiyatsuko who were invested with almost full power.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They were appointed as kuninomiyatsuko who were invested with almost full power.
They were appointed as kuninomiyatsuko who were invested with almost full power.

sen.j: (これ)に対し、王権の確立が早かった西日本では豪族の支配地域の地域をヤマト王権が掌握する支配体制の整備が早くから行われた為と考えられる。
sen.e: On the other hand, the system to rule the regions formerly governed by the local ruling families was built by Yamato sovereignty from early on in western Japan where the sovereignty was established during an early period, which was the reason why agatanonushi concentrated in western Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(文分割で不完全な文になったため、文頭カッコ内に必要な語句を補っています)/…掌握する支配体制: terms欄の訳語を使って「the ruling system to control …」とすると、冗長表現になると思われるので、「the system to rule…」と訳しています。
sen.e: On the other hand, the system to rule the regions formerly governed by the local ruling families was built by Yamato sovereignty from early on in western Japan where the sovereignty was established during an early period, which was the reason why agatanonushi concentrated in western Japan.

On the other hand, the system to rule the regions formerly governed by the local ruling families was built by Yamato sovereignty from early on in western Japan where the sovereignty was established during an early period, which was the reason why agatanonushi concentrated in western Japan.

sen.j: 八色の姓の導入や律令制度が導入された後も姓自体は存続していた。
sen.e: The kabane itself had existed even after the introduction of Yakusa no Kabane, the eight honorary titles, and the ritsuryo system.
The kabane itself had existed even after the introduction of Yakusa no Kabane, the eight honorary titles, and the ritsuryo system.
The kabane itself had existed even after the introduction of Yakusa no Kabane, the eight honorary titles, and the ritsuryo system.

sen.j: 近代でも県主が使われている例があり、主要な例に賀茂神社の鴨県主家などがある。
sen.e: In some cases, agatanonushi has been used as a title also in modern times, and the Kamo agatanonushi family of Kamo-jinja Shrine is a prime example of them.
sen.cmt: 鴨県主家: 定訳不明
sen.e: In some cases, agatanonushi has been used as a title also in modern times, and the Kamo agatanonushi family of Kamo-jinja Shrine is a prime example of them.
In some cases, agatanonushi has been used as a title also in modern times, and the Kamo agatanonushi family of Kamo-jinja Shrine is a prime example of them.
